description: From Latin plicātus, perfect passive participle of plicō (“I fold”).

adjectives.description: plicate (comparative more plicate, superlative most plicate)

entries.meaning: (biology) Folded multiple times lengthwise like a fan, usually lending stiffness to a flat structure such as a leaf; corrugated; pleated.

verbs.description: plicate (third-person singular simple present plicates, present participle plicating, simple past and past participle plicated)

entries.meaning: (chiefly biology) To fold or pleat (usually used in passive).
